title: UP's Mustafabad to be renamed? What CM Yogi said
description: In a move to honor cultural heritage, Uttar Pradesh's Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath declared the renaming of Mustafabad village in Lakhimpur Kheri to 'Kabirdham'. This decision seeks to revive the legacy of Sant Kabir, particularly underscoring the village's historical significance regardless of its current demographics. Adityanath's announcement aligns with other similar renaming efforts aimed at restoring the region's cultural roots.

description: Argentine President Javier Milei’s party, La Libertad Avanza (LLA), has won the 2025 legislative elections with over 40% of the vote, expanding its majority in Congress. LLA now holds 101 seats in the Chamber of Deputies and 20 in the Senate. The results boosted financial markets and strengthened the Argentine peso. Milei also announced plans to deepen ties with the U.S. and Israel, aligning Argentina more closely with Western economies while reassessing relations with China.

title: I-T withheld Rs 1.5 cr refund citing TDS mismatch - how taxpayer approached HC & won

This decision prevents Assessing Officers from arbitrarily withholding legitimate refunds, shifting the verification burden to them.

title: Iyer in ICU: Family could fly to Sydney soon, BCCI making arrangements
description: Indian cricketer Shreyas Iyer is hospitalized in Sydney following a fall during an ODI against Australia. He is in the ICU due to internal bleeding from a spleen laceration and is being closely monitored. The BCCI is arranging for his family to join him as he recovers, with his condition stable but requiring continued observation.

The court granted time to the Delhi Police to file a reply after the Additional Solicitor General sought a two-week extension.

title: How French police caught Louvre museum heist suspects
description: French authorities have arrested two suspects in connection with the Louvre's crown jewels heist. The arrests followed an analysis of forensic evidence, including DNA and fingerprints, and surveillance footage. One suspect was apprehended at the airport attempting to flee the country.

Shreyas Iyer in ICU: How the nasty fall turned into an emergency in Sydney
description: Team India's Shreyas Iyer is in Sydney's ICU after a severe fall during an ODI against Australia. He sustained a left rib cage injury while taking a catch, leading to alarming vital drops and internal bleeding, possibly a splenic rupture. Iyer's condition is now stable but under close medical watch.

description: India's electronics exports are surging, driven by booming iPhone production, and are projected to become the second-largest export category. This rise coincides with a potential decline in oil exports due to US sanctions on Russian crude, impacting refiners' purchases and eliminating price advantages.

Tragic! Indian Jujitsu player found dead; family alleges workplace harassment
description: International Jujitsu player Rohini Kalam, 35, was found dead at her Dewas residence, with preliminary findings suggesting suicide. Her sister reported work-related stress and alleged harassment from her school principal. Rohini, who had aspirations of becoming an IPS officer and had recently undergone surgery, was a decorated athlete with multiple international accolades.

Major update on Tom Aspinall following shocking eye poke spot at UFC 321
description: UFC 321's main event concluded controversially when Tom Aspinall was accidentally eye-poked by Ciryl Gane, rendering him unable to continue. Aspinall later shared an update, expressing significant concern about his eye injury, stating it's scarier than his previous knee injury. He has returned to England for further medical evaluation.

description: An 18-year-old MBBS student was allegedly raped and blackmailed by a 20-year-old man at a Delhi hotel. The accused reportedly drugged and sexually assaulted her, with associates helping to take compromising photos and videos for coercion. A case has been registered under the Bharatiya Nyay Samhita.

Despite the loud music, the kids remained unfazed, pulling blankets over their heads.  Internet was quick to react to the heartwarming video that sparked amusement and debate online, highlighting a playful approach to morning routines.

Shreyas Iyer still in ICU after dangerously low body vitals, internal bleeding
description: Indian cricketer Shreyas Iyer is currently in the ICU of a Sydney hospital following a serious fall during the third ODI against Australia. Reports indicate he experienced dangerously low body vitals post-incident and was immediately hospitalized in a critical, life-threatening condition. His recovery is ongoing.

title: JNU Polls 2025-26: Candidates file nominations today; when will the final list release?
description: Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) has entered the key phase of its 2025-26 student union elections, with candidates filing nominations on October 27. The final list of contestants will be released on October 28, followed by campaigning, debates, and polling on November 4. Results are expected on November 6, reflecting the campus’s dynamic political landscape.

description: A 45-year-old priest was arrested in Delhi for allegedly strangling his wife and attempting to stage it as a suicide. Delhi weather: Sunny skies, no rain; AQI remains very poor
description: New Delhi enjoys a sunny and pleasant Monday with temperatures reaching 31.7°C, ideal for outdoor plans. However, air quality remains a concern, with yesterday's AQI at 281 (Very Poor) due to high pollutants. While today's weather might slightly disperse pollutants, masks are advised for traffic-heavy areas. The week ahead promises mostly clear skies, except for Tuesday's potential rain.

title: Kolkata: Mob of 50 led by auto driver storms flat, assaults customs officer, wife
description: A customs inspector and his wife were brutally assaulted in their Kolkata home by a mob of 50, led by an auto driver, after a minor traffic altercation. Police, reportedly busy with Kali Puja immersions, arrived late, allowing most attackers to escape. Arrested individuals were quickly granted bail, sparking resident fears.

title: Sold land, crossed jungles: Over 50 Indians handcuffed, deported from US; agent vanishes with crores
description: Recently, more than 50 individuals, most between the ages of 25 and 30, found themselves back in Haryana after being deported from the US while trying to enter through the 'dunki' route. One deportee expressed frustration over losing Rs 57 lakh to a deceitful agent, facing intimidation and possible jail sentences as a result.

title: Gainfully 'employed': Rajasthan Officer ‘pays salaries’ to wife for fake jobs
description: Jaipur's anti-corruption bureau has filed a case against a senior IT department officer, Pradhyuman Dixit, for allegedly orchestrating illegal salary payments to his wife, Poonam Dixit, through two private firms. Over Rs 30 lakh was deposited into her accounts between 2019 and 2020, despite her never working for the companies. Authorities suspect these payments were bribes for IT contract favors.

title: UP highway horror: Sleeper bus gutted on Agra-Lucknow Expressway
description: A Delhi-Gonda sleeper bus caught fire early Sunday on the Agra-Lucknow Expressway. Driver Jagat Singh and aides Shyam Sundar and Manish swiftly evacuated all 39 passengers. Their quick thinking and brave actions prevented any loss of life. The bus was completely gutted before fire services arrived. Passengers praised the trio's courage.

title: Jharkhand blood bank blunder: HIV-positive blood given to 5 kids
description: Two officials are suspended following an incident where five children received HIV-positive blood. The Jharkhand Chief Minister announced financial aid and free treatment for the affected children. A probe panel will investigate the matter and suggest reforms. The High Court has also ordered an investigation into the serious lapse at Chaibasa Sadar Hospital.

title: Emiru-Mizkif controversy: How Twitch star’s breakup led to assault claims
description: Twitch streamer Emiru publicly accused ex-boyfriend Mizkif of sexual assault, emotional abuse, stalking, and blackmail threats. She detailed disturbing past threats and a new warning sign at TwitchCon 2025, prompting her to speak out for her safety. Mizkif admitted to toxic fights but denied assault, while Emiru is pursuing restraining orders.

title: GM layoffs: Engineers fired on Microsoft Teams; Says it's business, not you
description: General Motors has let go of over 200 salaried employees, mainly CAD engineers, at its Michigan tech campus. This move, part of a restructuring to boost profits, follows strong third-quarter earnings and a raised financial outlook. GM stated the layoffs target execution roles to enhance core design capabilities. This comes as the automotive sector sees broader workforce reductions.
